description: Retrieves the status of an asynchronous request to manage a Multi-Region Access Point. For more information about managing Multi-Region Access Points and how asynchronous requests work, see Using Multi-Region Access Points in the Amazon S3 User Guide. The following actions are related to GetMultiRegionAccessPoint:

parameters.name: AccountId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID for the owner of the Multi-Region Access Point.

parameters.name: RequestTokenARN
parameters.description: The request token associated with the request you want to know about. This request token is returned as part of the response when you make an asynchronous request. You provide this token to query about the status of the asynchronous action.

nested_items.name: AsyncOperation
nested_items.description: A container element containing the details of the asynchronous operation.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time that the request was sent to the service.

nested_items.name: Operation
nested_items.description: The specific operation for the asynchronous request.

nested_items.name: RequestTokenARN
nested_items.description: The request token associated with the request.

nested_items.name: RequestParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters associated with the request.

nested_items.name: CreateMultiRegionAccessPointRequest
nested_items.description: A container of the parameters for a CreateMultiRegionAccessPoint request.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Multi-Region Access Point associated with this request.

nested_items.name: PublicAccessBlock
nested_items.description: The PublicAccessBlock configuration that you want to apply to this Amazon S3 account. You can enable the configuration options in any combination. For more information about when Amazon S3 considers a bucket or object public, see The Meaning of 'Public' in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

nested_items.name: BlockPublicAcls
nested_items.description: Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public access control lists (ACLs) for buckets in this account. Setting this element to TRUE causes the following behavior:
PutBucketAcl and PutObjectAcl calls fail if the specified ACL is public.
PUT Object calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.
PUT Bucket calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.

nested_items.name: IgnorePublicAcls
nested_items.description: Specifies whether Amazon S3 should ignore public ACLs for buckets in this account. Setting this element to TRUE causes Amazon S3 to ignore all public ACLs on buckets in this account and any objects that they contain.

nested_items.name: BlockPublicPolicy
nested_items.description: Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public bucket policies for buckets in this account. Setting this element to TRUE causes Amazon S3 to reject calls to PUT Bucket policy if the specified bucket policy allows public access.

nested_items.name: RestrictPublicBuckets
nested_items.description: Specifies whether Amazon S3 should restrict public bucket policies for buckets in this account. Setting this element to TRUE restricts access to buckets with public policies to only Amazon Web Services service principals and authorized users within this account.

nested_items.name: Regions
nested_items.description: The buckets in different Regions that are associated with the Multi-Region Access Point.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the associated bucket for the Region.

nested_items.name: BucketAccountId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the Amazon S3 bucket that's associated with this Multi-Region Access Point.

nested_items.name: DeleteMultiRegionAccessPointRequest
nested_items.description: A container of the parameters for a DeleteMultiRegionAccessPoint request.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Multi-Region Access Point associated with this request.

nested_items.name: PutMultiRegionAccessPointPolicyRequest
nested_items.description: A container of the parameters for a PutMultiRegionAccessPoint request.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Multi-Region Access Point associated with the request.

nested_items.name: Policy
nested_items.description: The policy details for the PutMultiRegionAccessPoint request.

nested_items.name: RequestStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the request.

nested_items.name: ResponseDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the response.

nested_items.name: MultiRegionAccessPointDetails
nested_items.description: The details for the Multi-Region Access Point.

nested_items.name: Regions
nested_items.description: A collection of status information for the different Regions that a Multi-Region Access Point supports.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Region in the Multi-Region Access Point.

nested_items.name: RequestStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the Multi-Region Access Point in this Region.

nested_items.name: ErrorDetails
nested_items.description: Error details for an asynchronous request.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: A string that uniquely identifies the error condition.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A generic description of the error condition in English.

nested_items.name: Resource
nested_items.description: The identifier of the resource associated with the error.

nested_items.name: RequestId
nested_items.description: The ID of the request associated with the error.
